Package com.googlecode.cqengine.index.sqlite

Class RequestScopeConnectionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.cqengine.index.sqlite.RequestScopeConnectionManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConnectionManager, Closeable, AutoCloseable
    public class RequestScopeConnectionManager
extends Object
implements ConnectionManager, Closeable
    A ConnectionManager which create connections on-demand to the correct persistence for the indexes requesting the connection, and subsequently caches the connections, for re-use within the scope of the same request into CQEngine.

    Opens only one connection to each persistence, and returns the same already-open connection for subsequent requests.

    Connections are obtained from the Persistence object provided to the constructor. This can be a CompositePersistence which actually wraps more than one backing persistence. In that case, the CompositePersistence.getPersistenceForIndex(Index) method will be used to locate the correct persistence to use for the index requesting the connection.

    Author:
    niall.gallagher

      • isApplyUpdateForIndexEnabled

        public boolean isApplyUpdateForIndexEnabled​(Index<?> index)
        Description copied from interface: ConnectionManager
        Informs if index updates should be applied. This is for advanced use cases only, where the application supplies a custom ConnectionManager to CQEngine.
        Specified by:
        isApplyUpdateForIndexEnabled in interface ConnectionManager
        Parameters:
        index - The index.
        Returns:
        true if updates on the index should be applied. False otherwise.
